intro: Seseli elatum subsp. austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian seseli, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
